events.title: Formation of the First Fleet's Arrival at Botany Bay
events.description: The First Fleet, carrying convicts, marines, and officers, arrived at Botany Bay, marking the beginning of British colonization of Australia.
events.significance: This event marks the beginning of modern Australian history and British colonial expansion in the Pacific.

events.title: Battle of Guadalcanal Begins
events.description: The United States launched an amphibious assault on Guadalcanal in the Pacific, marking the first major offensive by Allied forces against Japan in World War II.
events.significance: It represented a turning point in the Pacific War, shifting the momentum towards the Allies.

events.title: Iraqi Forces Invade Kuwait
events.description: Iraq invaded Kuwait, leading to the Gulf War after an international coalition was formed to expel Iraqi forces.
events.significance: This invasion triggered the Gulf War and significant international military and political intervention.

events.title: Civil Rights Act Signed into U.S. Law
events.description: President Lyndon B. Johnson signed the Civil Rights Act of 1964 into law, prohibiting discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.
events.significance: The Act was a landmark victory in the American civil rights movement, outlawing segregation and employment discrimination.
